snippet: Takeda of Japan said it would fight the damages claim, awarded over the failure to adequately warn of the cancer risk of a diabetes drug.
abstract: Louisiana jury orders Japanese drug maker, Takeda Pharmaceutical, and its United States marketing partner Eli Lilly, to pay combined $9 billion in punitive damages over diabetes drug that has been linked to cancer.

byline.original: By MARTIN FACKLER and ANDREW POLLACK

lead_paragraph: Takeda of Japan said it would fight the damages claim, awarded over the failure to adequately warn of the cancer risk of a diabetes drug.

headline.main: Jury Awards $9 Billion in Damages in Drug Case
headline.print_headline: Jury Awards $9 Billion in Damages in Drug Case
